definition: to harm others/to mock people/to taunt/humiliating
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)

sentences.english: A self-described “victim” will always attract a “victimizer.”
sentences.chinese: 一个自我描述性“受害者”总是吸引着“损人者”。

sentences.english: The only rule of the market place was dog-eat-dog .
sentences.chinese: 市场上的唯一准则是损人利己。

sentences.english: Never do anything to your profit at another's expense.
sentences.chinese: 切不可作任何损人利己的事。

sentences.english: Those who attempt to profit at other's expense will come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 企图损人利已的人是不会有好下场的。

sentences.english: “China will never seek to advance its interests at the expense of others, ” Mr. Yang said, according to Reuters.
sentences.chinese: 据路透社报道，杨洁篪说，”中国不会损人利已。

sentences.english: As a Chinese man, I find this article to be deeply humiliating.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个中国男人，我觉得这篇文章很损人。

sentences.english: A self-described "victim" will always attract a "victimizer.
sentences.chinese: 一个自我描述性“受害者”总是吸引着“损人者”。

definition: harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
(dialect) sharp-tongued/harsh
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
annoying/disgusting
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
unpleasant/disagreeable
amusing/funny/entertaining
to insult/to direct bad language at sb/to slag off
to injure sb
propriety in speech
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
(theater) to dismantle the stage/(fig.) to pull the rug out from under sb's feet/to undermine sb's plans
